issues.description: The commented example usage in the template Main.java calls farm.feed(), but the problem statement and the intended solution use the method name feedAllAnimals(). This name mismatch in the template's sample code can confuse students who try to uncomment and run the example (they will get a compile error because feed() does not exist).
issues.suggested_fix: Update the commented example in template Main.java to call farm.feedAllAnimals() (matching the problem statement and solution), or add a delegating feed() method that calls feedAllAnimals() to avoid confusion. Prefer updating the sample to feedAllAnimals() so it matches the specification and solution.

issues.description: The template's Main.java references a Farm method named feed() (template_repository/src/de/tum/cit/ase/Main.java) while the problem statement and the reference solution specify the method name feedAllAnimals(). This inconsistent naming for the same conceptual operation (feeding all animals on the farm) can confuse students about which method to implement or call and may cause them to search for a non-existent method or implement the wrong name.
issues.suggested_fix: Align the template with the problem statement and solution by replacing the erroneous call to farm.feed() in template_repository/src/de/tum/cit/ase/Main.java with farm.feedAllAnimals(). Alternatively, add a simple delegating method feed() in Farm that calls feedAllAnimals() and document it, but the clearer fix is to update the template Main to call feedAllAnimals() so names match the specification and reference solution.
